title: Calories in Pollo Tropical Chicken
meta_description: Discover calories in pollo tropical, including a standard serving's total kcal, protein, fat, carbs, and nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Grilled citrus-marinated chicken, skinless, boneless breast; standard Pollo Tropical recipe; ~170 g per serving (one piece).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by portion size, skin inclusion, marinade, cooking method, and restaurant preparation. Check Pollo Tropical's menu or app for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One serving of Pollo Tropical grilled chicken provides ~255 kcal and ~42 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with restaurant or packaged info.

tweaks.label: With skin on (adds ~2 g fat per 100 g)
Skinless thigh instead of breast (higher fat)

faqs.q: How many calories in one piece of pollo tropical?
faqs.a: About 255 kcal for a 170 g skinless grilled breast serving.

faqs.q: What is the protein in pollo tropical chicken?
faqs.a: Roughly 42.5 g protein per standard 170 g serving.
Plain grilled chicken has 0 g carbs; sides like rice or beans add them.

faqs.q: How does skin affect calories in pollo tropical?
faqs.a: Skin-on increases calories by ~45 per serving due to added fat.

faqs.q: What about sodium in pollo tropical?
faqs.a: Around 510 mg per serving from the citrus-garlic marinade.
